sources.title: The Trespasser
sources.description: Title: The Trespasser Summary: The trial and tribulations of a strong-willed woman who elopes and gives birth out of wedlock without telling her ex-husband. Directed by: Edmund Goulding Actors: Gloria Swanson, Robert Ames, Purnell Pratt Production Company: Gloria Productions Release Date: 11 November 1929 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.20 : 1 A stenographer who works for a lawyer falls in love with and marries a wealthy young man. His family has the marraige annulled, after which she gives birth to a child. Her former boss helps her out to ensure the child's welfare, which starts gossip that she is a "kept woman."

sources.title: The Trespasser (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. One of Gloria Swansons few box office successes in the sound era, this drama earned her a Best Actress nomination for her role. She would go on to lead five more talkies that would all flop, before coming back nearly twenty years later to star in Sunset Boulevard. The plot of The Trespasser is slightly convoluted, but it essentially follows a woman as she is repeatedly betrayed by the men in her life.

sources.title: The Trespasser (1929) GLORIA SWANSON
sources.description:
Stars: Gloria Swanson, Robert Ames, Purnell Pratt 
Writer/Director: Edmund Goulding

This Pre-code Tearjerker stars silent screen icon Gloria Swanson in her first "talking" picture. Swanson’s dramatic performance earned her a 2nd “Best Actress” Oscar Nomination, and  was remembered by Billy Wilder when casting the role of Norma Desmond for the classic Sunset Boulevard.

metadata.Plot: A stenographer who works for a lawyer falls in love with and marries a wealthy young man. His family has the marraige annulled, after which she gives birth to a child. Her former boss helps her out to ensure the child's welfare, which starts gossip that she is a "kept woman."
